ygData.subject: Re: cd examples/cxx; make
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The problem is fixed. On my Gentoo Linux, which g77 run under root does not indicate the path towards g77. However this command works for any user.

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "tlepo2000" <thierry.lepoint@t...> wrote:
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> 

The problem is fixed.
On my Gentoo Linux, 'which g77' run under root does not indicate the
path towards g77. However this command works for any user.
Therefore I just run both './configure' and 'make' as a user. As it is
mentioned in the C++ booklet, I run 'make install' as root.
Now, ./cxx_examples works fine.

My best.

Thierry
------------------------------

> Thank you very much for your rapid answer, Dr Goodwin. You are right
> there is some problems with my Fortran librairies.
> I followed your suggestion. However I identified that I cannot used
> g77 directly on my Gentoo workstation (gcc -x f77 works fine but I
> have still the same problem in the "make" associated with
> examples/cxx). The g77 command does not exist on my gentoos and I have
> no means to "emerge" it. In constrast, on a mandrake 9.1, I have no
> problem with cantera.
> I am continuing and inform the list in case of success with
> g77/gentoo/cantera.
> 
> My best wishes,
> Thierry
-----------------------------------------------
> 
> 
> > I think it is a Fortran problem.  Probably it is not finding some  
> > Fortran library. Maybe try running the default 'configure' script  
> > without modifications first, since it comes set up to build on linux  
> > with g++, g77, etc.

--------------------------------------------------
> > 
> > 
> > On May 11, 2004, at 3:42 PM, tlepo2000 wrote:
> > 
> > > Dear Collegues,
> > >
> > > The present comment deals with the install of cantera-1.5 (or
-1.5.2)
> > > on a Gentoo Linux workstation (stable packages). The tar file was
> > > copied in /usr/local and produced a cantera directory after "tar
> > > zxvf".
> > > I commented lines associated with the preparation of Fortran,
MathLab
> > > and Python interfaces (the configure file).CANTERA_ROOT and PATH
were
> > > fixed to /usr/local/cantera and $CANTERA_ROOT/bin, respectively.
> > > I used gcc/g++ 3.3.2 which includes g77. Line F77 in configure was
> > > uncommented and its f77 was replaced by gcc. Morevover line
containing
> > > F90 was commented.
> > >
> > > ./ configure, make and make install worked.
> > >
> > > The "make" in examples/cxx ended with:
> > >
> > > g++ -o ./cxx_examples examples.o kinetics_examples1.o ...
> > > /usr/local/cantera/build/lib/i686-pc-linux-gnu/lre
> > > cipes.a(simplx.o)(text+0x4a
> > > ): in function <<simplx_>>: undefined reference to `s_pass`
> > >
> > > The same was reproduced several times and related to:
> > > libctlapack
> > > libctmath
> > > lictblas
> > >
> > > As a consequence cxx_examples was not generated.
> > >
> > > I would be very grateful for any help. Thank in advance.
> > >
> > > Thierry Lepoint, Prof. at the Institut Meurice (Belgium)
